intro: Lagochilus kotschyanus, commonly known as Kotschan's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Lagochilus kotschyanus is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
